ProjectDescr.Title: Transcriptome sequencing
ProjectDescr.Description: Ubiquitination is reversed by deubiquitinating enzymes (DUBs), a group of proteases that remove monoubiquitin or polyubiquitin chains from the substrate. TRABID, encoded by the ZRANB1 gene, is a DUB that specifically disassembles K29- and K33-linked ubiquitin chains. We identified the peptide capable to interference with TRABID and target substrate and analyzed transcriptome sequencing using next generation sequencing technique.

Grant.Title: Therapeutic strategy for non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) through regulation of TRABID activity
